snippet: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan is facing his worst political crisis in more than a decade of power, and he seems little inclined to change his approach.
abstract: Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan is facing his worst political crisis in more than a decade of power, and he seems little inclined to change his approach; throughout demonstrations and upheaval, his behavior has given new fuel to already-simmering questions about his aims and methods--whether he has turned more autocrat than democrat, or at the least whether a deft politician has fallen into overconfidence.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu and Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan is facing his worst political crisis in more than a decade of power, and he seems little inclined to change his approach.

headline.seo: Turkish Protests Raise Questions on Leader’s Rule
headline.main: As Turks Challenge Their Leader’s Power, He Tries to Expand It
headline.print_headline: As Turks Challenge Their Leader’s Power, He Tries to Expand It
